text.0: install at sacrifice while the rite advances your pleasant heavenly agni meet for praises.
text.1: with hymnsfor he illumines usinstall him he jātavedas makes our rites successful.
text.2: hear this laud radiant priest of many aspects o agni with the fires of man enkindled.
text.3: laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter strength to this man as twere for selfadvantage.
text.4: mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to agni.
text.5: and the god wondrous bright with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle.
text.6: he at his birth whose path is black behind him filled heaven and earth with farapparent splendour.
text.7: and he himself hath been through nights thick darkness made manifest by light the purifier.
text.8: with thy most mighty aid confer o agni wonderful wealth on us and on our princes.
text.9: who stand preeminent surpassing others in liberal gifts in fame and hero virtues.
text.10: agni accept this sacrifice with gladness which seated here the worshipper presenteth.
text.11: fair hymns hadst thou among the bharadvājas and holpest them to gain abundant vigour.
text.12: scatter our foes increase our store may we he glad a hundred winters with brave sons.
